name: Cunaz
description:
This is a beautiful canyon that begins wet, and continues to be wet from start to finish. There are plenty of bolts that are either brand new, or in good condition as of June 23rd 2021. There are 11 rappels, the first 10 are back to back in rapid succession with the final rappel being down the canyon a good bit after a good bit of rock hoping, scrambling, and down climbing. Would highly recommend brining a wet suit and neoprene socks, as you will be in the water the wide majority of the time.

Approach

Would recommend parking here: (46.0704887, 12.5105464)

About a 50 minute approach if going at a mellow pace. Start of the canyon: (46.0814443, 12.5155732)

Descent

Exit

Red tape
